DOC.brief_title: Epidural Anesthesia Postoperative Analgesia With Ropivacaine Fentanyl
DOC.detailed_description: Ninety-three patient schedule off-pump coronary artery bypass ( OPCAB ) propofol/fentanyl anesthesia . Day surgery patient ask informed consent randomize three postoperative analgesia regimen aim visual analog scale ( VAS ) score < 30 mm rest . The control group ( n=31 ) receive intravenous fentanyl 10 µg/ml postoperatively 3-8 mL/h . After placement epidural catheter level Th2-Th4 OPCAB , thoracic epidural infusion ( EI ) group ( n=31 ) receive epidural anesthesia ( EA ) intraoperatively ropivacaine 0.75 % 1 mg/kg fentanyl 1 µg/kg follow continuous EI ropivacaine 0.2 % 3-8 mL/h fentanyl 2 µg/mL postoperatively . The patient-controlled epidural analgesia ( PCEA ) group ( n=31 ) , addition EA EI , receive PCEA ( ropivacaine/fentanyl bolus 1 mL , lock-out interval 12 min ) postoperatively . Hemodynamics blood gas measure throughout 24 h OPCAB .
DOC.criteria: presence coronary artery disease ASA IIIII elective offpump coronary artery bypass age < 18 year severe valve dysfunction peripheral vascular disease simultaneous intervention ( carotid endarterectomy , aneurysm repair , etc . ) transfer CPB surgery
